hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
#!/bin/bash
# Clean up git repo #git clean -fdx
# If this is the first time building, then make sure that we build all of the packages if [ ! -f ./old-commit ]; then git rev-list --max-count=1 HEAD > old-commit BUILD_ALL=true fi
git rev-list --max-count=1 HEAD > new-commit
rm -f changed-packages
if [ "x${BUILD_ALL}" == "xtrue" ]; then CHANGED=$(./What_can_I_update\?.py -l | grep -v 'qt-ubuntu') else CHANGED="" for i in $(git diff --name-only $(cat old-commit) $(cat new-commit) | grep '/PKGBUILD'); do i=${i%/*} CHANGED+=" ${i}" done fi
for i in ${CHANGED}; do echo "Package ${i} was changed, will rebuild" PKG="${i//-/_}" PKG="${PKG//./_}" echo "build_${PKG}=true" >> changed-packages done
# Make sure nothing is built twice #for i in ${CHANGED}; do # depends=$(sudo -u nobody /srv/jenkins/get-from-pkgbuild.sh ${i}/PKGBUILD 'depends[@]') # makedepends=$(sudo -u nobody /srv/jenkins/get-from-pkgbuild.sh ${i}/PKGBUILD 'makedepends[@]') # for j in ${depends} ${makedepends}; do # if grep -q "^build_${j//-/_}=true$" changed-packages; then # echo "${i} will not be triggered by this project. It's dependency, ${j}, will trigger it." # sed -i "/^build_${i//-/_}=true$/d" changed-packages # break # fi # done #done
mv new-commit old-commit
